properties.areaDesc: Northern Oxford; Northern Coos; Southern Coos; Central Somerset; Northern Franklin
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 6 at 6:34PM EST until February 7 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
...WINTRY MIX CONTINUES THROUGH FRIDAY...

.Light mixed precipitation will continue for much of the night
into Friday morning followed by renewed steady precipitation as
a strong storm system develops over the region. Overnight much of
the area from the mountains south will see light freezing rain or
freezing drizzle. This may make roads, sidewalks, and elevated
surfaces very slick. Additional significant snowfall is likely in
the mountains Friday. Expect the morning and evening commutes to
remain hazardous for travel.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation and heavy snowfall. Additional snow
accumulations of 5 to 14 inches for a storm total of 8 to 18
inches, sleet accumulations of around 1 inch and ice
accumulations of around one tenth of an inch.

* WHERE...In New Hampshire, Southern Coos and Northern Coos
Counties. In Maine, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin and
Northern Oxford Counties.

* WHEN...Until 10 PM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the commutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Mixed precipitation is most likely tonight.
Snow will become more dominant Friday morning and may be heavy
at times through the day.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of
snow...sleet...and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are
also possible.  This will make travel very hazardous or
impossible.

For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to
www.weather.gov/gray.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST FRIDAY
